body_html:
better to rework highwash, actually now only highwash follows different pattern than the rest of the extern cmake files On Wed, 11 Jul 2018 at 06:18, Stefan Dyulgerov <stefan.dyulgerov@gmail.com> wrote:
…
From the cmake file i see that it needs the same, Though it did not occured to be on windows 10. nsync there forced rebuild every time. but it did not occured to me. I guess depends on the build systems. cmake that produces msbuild project files work with dates to check dependencies. I am not familiar with bazel and ninja though, if they check contents of the file, may be different. anyway, i will investigate more for highwash, may be it was not compiled in my build. On Wed, 11 Jul 2018 at 01:27, Mike Burrows ***@***.***> wrote: > ***@***.**** commented on this pull request. > > It looks good, but I'm confused. > > When I created this file, I copied its structure > from highwayhash.cmake. > So why aren't we having the same problem > with that file? > Or if we are having the problem with that file, > shouldn't we fix that also? > > — > You are receiving this because you authored the thread. > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub > <#20574 (review)>, > or mute the thread > <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABF5cQ_zKG7552nKxQe3XHJnWxuPqj0zks5uFSpBgaJpZM4VEVdq> > . >
body_text:
better to rework highwash, actually now only highwash follows different
pattern than the rest of the extern cmake files

wrote:
…
 From the cmake file i see that it needs the same,
 Though it did not occured to be on windows 10.
 nsync there forced rebuild every time.
 but it did not occured to me.
 I guess depends on the build systems. cmake that produces msbuild project
 files work with dates to check dependencies. I am not familiar with bazel
 and ninja though, if they check contents of the file, may be different.
 anyway, i will investigate more for highwash, may be it was not compiled
 in my build.
